messages.content: The Tories are letting the people of Bournemouth East down. Only a Labour Government will protect your health, education, housing and working conditions. We will stand up for you.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: The Living Wage & Zero Hours Contracts
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will introduce a living wage of £10 per hour and put an end to exploitative Zero Hours Contracts.
A fairer tax system that ensures that large multi-national companies pay taxes on the profits they earn in this country.
Labour will create a million good quality jobs by investing £50 billion in infrastructure and industry, including by establishing a National Investment Bank.
Labour will deliver a million new homes over five years with at least half for social rent.
We will act on climate change and fulfill the Paris climate agreement by hosting a charter for green jobs and new industries with a fair transition to a low-carbon economy.

issues.economy: Labour will introduce a living wage of £10 per hour. A fairer tax system that ensures that large multi-national companies pay taxes on the profits they earn in this country.
issues.education: For our schools, we want smaller class sizes, more funding and the reinstatement of Local Education Authorities. In Further Education we need to re-establish the Education Maintenance Allowance for 16-18 year olds and guarantee quality apprenticeships and adult skills training.
issues.environment: We will act on climate change and fulfill the Paris climate agreement by hosting a charter for green jobs and new industries with a fair transition to a low-carbon economy.
issues.health: Labour will protect the NHS. We face longer waiting times and overcrowded hospitals. We will restore nurses' bursaries and scrap the 1% pay cap. We will put an end to private companies making a profit from the NHS. Labour will join up services from home to hospital with a properly integrated health and social care system. Mental health will be given the same priority as physical health to provide a health and social care service centered on people and their families.
issues.labourEmployment: Labour will create a million good quality jobs by investing £50 billion in infrastructure and industry, including by establishing a National Investment Bank.

community.content: Labour will deliver a million new homes over five years with at least half for social rent.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am a resident of Bournemouth East having been born here. I work in Higher Education and before this I worked for the NHS and know that education, health and social care are important issues that affect us all. In light of the EU Referendum I believe in the democratic process and the will of the people. I will work hard to get the best exit deal for Bournemouth East and our country. I will strive, to the best of my abilities, to represent your interests and our community in parliament by being accessible to people and eager to advance the issues closest to you with principles of fairness, inclusivity and social justice at the core. I would like the opportunity to invest in and protect the social needs of Bournemouth East.

endorsements.endorsement: Mel is a woman of enormous commitment and personal integrity. She knows the people of this town have been let down by the Tories with a struggling health system and social care services that have been cut to the bone. Mel will fight for every single person in Bournemouth East, irrespective of their background. I’ve known Mel for many years and your vote could not go to a better person.

images.caption: Mel Semple with other local Labour candidates
